{"id":1466755245,"question_id":2729,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 months, 1 week","timestamp":1732995898,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1466755245/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Make Numbers Non-positive","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minOperations(vector<int>& nums, int x, int y) {\n        int left = 0;\n        int right = INT_MAX/2;\n        while(left<right) {\n            int mid = left+(right-left)/2;\n            if(isOK(mid, nums, x, y)) {\n                right = mid;\n            } else\n                left = mid+1;\n        }\n        return left;\n    }\n    bool isOK(int mid, vector<int>& nums, int x, int y) {\n        int count = 0;\n        float xydiff = x-y;\n        float num_diff = 0.0;\n        for(int i=0; i<nums.size(); i++) {\n            num_diff = (nums[i]-mid*1.0*y); \n            if(num_diff <=0)\n                continue;\n            count += ceil( num_diff/xydiff );\n            if(count > mid)\n                return false;\n        }\n        return true;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-make-numbers-non-positive","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
